ID: C1EXRV4_00
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Milan Milosavic <Milan.Milosavic@loccitane.me>
CC: 
BCC: 
Date: 2025-02-25 13:14
Subject: Claim adjustment - L'Occitane City Walk - 15/04/2024
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Milan,

 

First of all, sorry for the delay.

 

Till now, I got approval from the surveyor on the below:

 

Stock + Bar Loss (Cost of Goods)                  : AED 10,055

Compressor Damage                                         : AED 16,850

Reduction in Gross Profit (2.5 days)              : AED 30,379

Total:                                                                        : AED 57,284

Policy Excess (10%)                                            : (AED 5,728)

Net Settlement                                                    : AED 51,555

 

For PCDE, Linah and Excom lost catering business, I’m pushing to get around AED 2,500 net to pocket further to the above figure.

 

There are some points that I need your help with:

metadata.doc_id: C1EXRV4 - claim adjustment - l'occitane city walk - 15 04 2024\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\C1EXRV4 - claim adjustment - l'occitane city walk - 15 04 2024\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Net Settlement                                                    : AED 51,555

 

For PCDE, Linah and Excom lost catering business, I’m pushing to get around AED 2,500 net to pocket further to the above figure.

 

There are some points that I need your help with:

 

*	For Khalid LPDR lost catering business, did you have a quotation sent?
*	Also, for all four catering lost businesses, please forward the correspondence intimating that would not be able to fulfil the catering orders due to the incident.
*	Also, the supplier’s guide, can you clarify what these are relating to. This is not approved till now at least
*	For the compressor repair with Zecorp, can you please share the final invoice and the bank transfer advice copy as proof of payment, this is required.

 

Any information you can provide for the attachments will be useful to be able to successfully claim for the respective losses.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

From: Milan Milosavic <Milan.Milosavic@loccitane.me> 
Sent: 25 February 2025 1:47 PM
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: Claim adjustment - L'Occitane City Walk - 15/04/2024

 

Dear Hagop,

 

Hope all is well 

 

I completely understand, like I said, it is just important money to be in L'Occitane account before we close this fiscal ends 

 

For catering business 

 

Quotations had been sent already to all clients during that period - I am checking with Khaled if he is able to send me communication with clients as proof.

 

For the compressor repair and replacement, I couldn't provide proof of payment because I found another cheaper contractor and the total price was around 1000 aed in the end.

 

Could you please advise me on the supplier guide? I am not sure that I understand it clearly. 

 

Thank you 

 

Regards

 

 

 

Get Outlook for iOS <https://aka.ms/o0ukef> 

MILAN MILOSAVIC​​​​

EXECUTIVE CHEF



 

________________________________

*	Also, for all four catering lost businesses, please forward the correspondence intimating that would not be able to fulfil the catering orders due to the incident.
*	Also, the supplier’s guide, can you clarify what these are relating to. This is not approved till now at least
*	For the compressor repair with Zecorp, can you please share the final invoice and the bank transfer advice copy as proof of payment, this is required.

 

Any information you can provide for the attachments will be useful to be able to successfully claim for the respective losses.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Tuesday, February 25, 2025 1:14 PM
To: Milan Milosavic <Milan.Milosavic@loccitane.me <mailto:Milan.Milosavic@loccitane.me> >
Subject: Claim adjustment - L'Occitane City Walk - 15/04/2024 

 

Dear Milan,

 

First of all, sorry for the delay.

 

Till now, I got approval from the surveyor on the below:

 

Stock + Bar Loss (Cost of Goods)                  : AED 10,055

Compressor Damage                                         : AED 16,850

Reduction in Gross Profit (2.5 days)              : AED 30,379

Total:                                                                        : AED 57,284

Policy Excess (10%)                                            : (AED 5,728)

Net Settlement                                                    : AED 51,555

 

For PCDE, Linah and Excom lost catering business, I’m pushing to get around AED 2,500 net to pocket further to the above figure.

 

There are some points that I need your help with:

 

*	For Khalid LPDR lost catering business, did you have a quotation sent?
*	Also, for all four catering lost businesses, please forward the correspondence intimating that would not be able to fulfil the catering orders due to the incident.
*	Also, the supplier’s guide, can you clarify what these are relating to. This is not approved till now at least
*	For the compressor repair with Zecorp, can you please share the final invoice and the bank transfer advice copy as proof of payment, this is required.

Dear Milan,

Please find below the final loss adjustment computation:


Stock + Bar Loss (Cost of Goods):         AED 10,055          

Additional loss for Supplies            AED    5,000             (lost supplies)

Compressor Damage:                  AED    1,389          (adjusted)

Physical Damage                     AED 16,444




Reduction in Gross Profit (2.5 days):           AED 30,379             (Daily GP considered at AED 12,151.60)

Lost Catering GP (50% considered):     AED    3,028            (AED 8,651 * 70% * 50%)

BI Loss                                 AED 33,407



Total Loss:                           AED 49,851
Less Policy Excess (10%):               (AED 4,985)
Net Loss                              AED 44,866




Trust the above is in order. Please confirm in order to sign, stamp and forward to the insurance company for finalization.




Best Regards,

Hagop

*	Also, for all four catering lost businesses, please forward the correspondence intimating that would not be able to fulfil the catering orders due to the incident.
*	Also, the supplier’s guide, can you clarify what these are relating to. This is not approved till now at least
*	For the compressor repair with Zecorp, can you please share the final invoice and the bank transfer advice copy as proof of payment, this is required.

 

Any information you can provide for the attachments will be useful to be able to successfully claim for the respective losses.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
